summary: This document is an email chain from May 2017 regarding quotes for a camera system upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It involves a DOJ communication technician requesting pricing from SigNet Technologies, a federal contractor, for security equipment.

persons.name: Steve Smith
persons.context: Steve Smith is a sales representative for SigNet Technologies who handles quotes for system upgrades and is included in the email chain to provide pricing information.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Justin Houston is a program manager for FBOP contracts at SigNet Technologies who forwards the request for camera system upgrade quotes to Steve Smith.

connections.description: Both are employees of SigNet Technologies working together on a contract request from the DOJ for camera system upgrades.

events.title: Request for Camera System Upgrade Quotes
events.description: A DOJ communication technician at MCC New York emails Justin Houston requesting quotes for a camera system upgrade, including partial and full upgrades, and individual decoder/encoder costs.

events.title: Email Chain with Updated Quotes
events.description: Steve Smith responds to the email chain with updated quotes for the camera system upgrade, referencing previous pricing from December.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
SigNet Technologies, 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The document is a 2017 email chain about obtaining quotes for a camera system upgrade at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
SigNet Technologies is a contractor providing security equipment to the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) under DOJ contracts.
The request originates from a DOJ communication technician at MCC New York, indicating facility security upgrades were being considered.
The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers about proprietary information from SigNet Technologies.
This appears to be routine procurement correspondence, not directly related to Epstein case events, but from the MCC where Epstein was later held.
